title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: By the time the Mermaid was reached, there were only left Vergil, Juris, and the Professor, besides two or three more of their closer companions. The next minute they also had left a vacant space in the street, and, finding comfortable quarters in " The Grove " below, began to regale themselves with tankards of ale and Betty Simpson's hard " bawbee bakes."

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: The atmosphere of the Mermaid was close and stuffy, so much so, indeed, that Juris declared his friend Vergil had uttered more strange oaths within half an hour that night, than he had heard for a whole twelvemonth. The Grove simply reeked with the smell of whisky and stale tobacco. It was with considerable difficulty, therefore, that Vergil, who had been suffering from a bronchial affection for some time, was able to breathe in its midst.
